attributes.action: Invoice embassies based in the U.K. for NHS costs incurred by health tourists
attributes.background: The NHS is in danger of collapse. It cannot afford to treat people who come to the U.K. for healthcare and then refuse to pay for their treatment which often runs into hundreds of thousands of pounds. I believe that the country of origin should be held responsible and be made to pay.
attributes.additional_details: A recent documentary highlighted three cases, a woman from the Philipines who needed a quadruple heart bypass, a Turkish man in a similar situation and a woman who had fertility treatment abroad and after being refused entry to the USA, came to the U.K. and ran up a bill of over £300,000 at a London hospital. Three cases, almost £1,000,000 which will never be repaid and could be better spent on staff, services and equipment to treat people who qualify.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal act to present wrong information to influence a public vote.
attributes.background: With the recent public vote in the UK it is clear that the argument was heavily influenced by individuals knowingly communicating wrong information.  The act of knowingly presenting unverified facts for influence should be  punished.  The message is that our democracy will not accept such behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: There has in the past year been an upsurge in politicians and individuals presenting fake facts to influence votes of national importance.  These "fake facts" and "fake news" have been seen as an acceptable tactic by the perpetrators. Our country needs to get this under control and send a signal because its continuation will undermine the democratic process.  Without sanctions these types of lies will undermine our society. The action needs to cover both traditional and social media.

attributes.action: Permanently seize any vehicle used by a drink/drug driver following a conviction
attributes.background: Once a person is convicted of drink/drug driving they keep the vehicle that was used during the commission of the offence. This could be following a 12 - 24 month ban passed by a court. The vehicle will usually remain outside the home address of the person convicted, until temptation to use it hits.

attributes.action: Make the National Lottery a direct fund of the National Health Service
attributes.background: Lottery money paid by all Citizens to be the income of the National Health Service

attributes.action: Core travel infrastructure should seek ACAS approval prior to strike action
attributes.background: 2016 has seen various industrial strike actions due various industrial disputes. The Government should appoint an independent body i.e. ACAS (Advisory, Conciliation & Arbitration Service) to mediate between core travel businesses and Unions to ensure that any strike action is avoided where possible.
attributes.additional_details:
2016 saw an increase in strike action a total of 269,000 days lost due to industrial action since October 2016. This is over a 50% increase to the figures of 2015 which is 169,000 days lost due to industrial action (figures from Office for National Statistics)
Core travel infrastructure industrial actions needs to assure that Unions voices are heard with assurance that their request to strike are reasonable & limited. Strike action causes increased travel time and costs to thousands of commuters

attributes.action: Implement a 20% tariff on all goods imported from the United States of America
attributes.background:
After a row over who would pay for a wall between the USA & Mexico, a bilateral summit between the two nations was cancelled by the Mexican president.
In response, President Trump now seeks to impose a 20% tariff on all Mexican goods.
In response the UK should impose a similar penalty on the USA.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is to ask the house to debate the imposition of a similarly punitive trade tariff as that which President Trump wishes to impose on Mexico. The whole world needs to stand up to bullies and the UK should lead by example.

The last time the world appeased a bully, 80 years ago, it didn't end well.

attributes.action: Before any vote on Article 50 the government must publish the trade consequences
attributes.background: MP's would be stupid to trigger Article 50 without first knowing the trade rules that would come into effect as a result. The referendum ballot did not permit MP's to be irresponsible. The public have a right to know what trade rules MPs will put in place if they decide to vote to trigger Article 50
attributes.additional_details: Only 37% of the electorate voted "leave". The vast majority of the electorate want conditions to improve following any parliamentary vote on Article 50. MPs must be able to assure the public that if they vote to trigger Article 50, trading relations will not be worsened and restrictions will not be placed on financial institutions that will damage our economy. Therefore before any parliamentary vote on Article 50, MPs must publish in full all the arrangements that will then come into effect.

attributes.action: Give commonwealth immigrants citizenship who lived in this country for 10 years
attributes.background: Most residents have started families here their children have never been out of the country. Most African countries now struggling economically than they were 10 years ago political instability, human rights abuses gender equality

attributes.action: Ban the use of Body Mass Index (BMI) as a measure of obesity by NHS
attributes.background: Set in 1830 by a non-medical mathematician and astronomer, BMI is an inaccurate measure of body fat content and does not take into account muscle mass, bone density, overall body composition, racial and sex differences. When Johnny Wilkinson won the RWC he was officially overweight according to BMI.
attributes.additional_details: There is an urgent need for accurate tools to measure fat and skeletal muscle, and biomarkers that can better predict the risks of diseases and mortality. Advances to improve the measurement of obesity and related factors will help determine the optimal weight for an individual, taking into account factors such as age, sex, genetics, fitness, pre-existing diseases, as well as novel blood markers and metabolic parameters altered by obesity. (Ahima and Lazar, Science, August 2013)

attributes.action: Cap private rent in line with local council rent. End the housing crisis.
attributes.background: It's time something was done about the astronomical prices of renting a house through a private landlord. Fat cats,are buying all the houses, then renting at inflated prices.  If it was capped in line with council rent. The housing crisis would be helped significantly.
attributes.additional_details:
How are the next generation supposed to get on the housing ladder. Massive private rents mean, no savings.  Therefore no deposit. And in many cases,  living hand to mouth. 
The housing crisis could be eased, if rent wasn't allowed to be inflated by the greedy affluent property owners/developers. House prices would fall and settle at an affordable level.  And the greedy wouldn't want them so much if they weren't allowed to extort money from the less well off

attributes.action: Allow all Mains Post Offices in the UK to be able to issue passport forms.
attributes.background: Many main Post Offices are being asked for Passport forms on a daily basis. We undertake every other aspect of travel : insurance, currency, travel money cards and credit cards. Why do we have to send customers to competitors when we could issue and check and send passports?
attributes.additional_details: We want a level playing field for all main Post Offices who would all offer this essential service.

attributes.action: Populate the Isle of Wight with Deer
attributes.background: Currently there are only a handful of deer on the Isle of Wight due to everytime any are spotted they are exterminated but I think that having deer on the island if controlled satisfactorily would be a good asset for the island.

attributes.action: 2 p should be put on income tax solely for the purpose of funding NHS resources
attributes.background: Background??? - look around - ask people - take a (cynical) look at the news - ask your GP - ask the next person you see in a wheelchair - visit any oncology unit - If nothing's done a lot of people will die a cold, lonely, painful, hideous death

attributes.action: To reinstate the death penalty for heinous and serious crimes.
attributes.background: If the death penalty is reinstated as punishment for those who commit heinous crimes (terrorism, the harm of children, murder) it will deter those who are thinking about committing such acts, as 'common sense tells us that the death penalty will deter murder'.
attributes.additional_details:
It will also support the belief that bad things come to those who deserve it.

'Common sense tells us that the death penalty will deter murder.' 
-- Ernest van den Haag PhD
Late professor of psychology at Fordham university.

'I believe that the death penalty is appropriate in certain circumstances. There are extraordinarily heinous crimes, terrorism, the harm of children, in which it may be appropriate.' 
-- Barack Obama, on the subject of capital punishment, 2012
44th U.S. President.

attributes.action: Hold a general election as so we can vote on the policies of Brexit.
attributes.background: We are facing Brexit whether you voted for it or not. Now we need to vote on the terms of the Brexit. An unelected leader should not lead the Brexit negations.
attributes.additional_details:
A general election should be held to allow our parties to form their plan for Brexit allowing the electorate to have a say with the power of a vote. 

An unelected leader is not the right person for the job.

attributes.action: Remove the unecessary, excessively armed, MoD presence in Scotland
attributes.background: The Rosneath peninsula in Scotland is home to a widely unpopular military installation. The MoD have, with little to no consultation with the local population, increased their presence in the region. This needs to be undone handing back Scottish policing to Police Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: In a move the government has justified with maintaining national security more weapons and officers with more of a will to use them are being placed in rural Scotland. This is supposedly to defend a military installation which many Scots do not want on their land and do not want so dangerously close to their population centres.

attributes.action: Urgent review of Royal Navy capabilities, with immediate action on results.
attributes.background:
The Harrier Jet was scrapped by the UK in 2010, (USA will scrap them in 2025). Our last Aircraft Carrier was scrapped in 2016.
The replacement will enter service possibly in 2020.
I want our Government to immediately find a solution to this massive capability gap and implement it without delay.
attributes.additional_details:
The Harrier Jump Jet was scrapped in 2010 (USA will scrap them in 2025).  Our last Aircraft Carrier was scrapped in 2016.
No replacement has yet entered service. The MOD accountants have left this once great Maritime Nation defenceless. Utter madness to dispose of essential defence equipment before the replacement has been thoroughly trialled and allowed to enter service.
I want our Government to immediately find a solution to this massive capability gap and implement it without delay.

attributes.action: Reclassify forced entry or attempted entry into a home as an act of terrorism.
attributes.background: The distress and terror caused by someone trying to force their way into your home is a much more real and likely occurence than any threat from those acts currently classified as terrorist. These acts, however, cause real feelings of terror in the victims with a long lasting sense of insecurity.
attributes.additional_details:
From the perspective of the victim, there are far fewer resources available for the detection and apprehension of the perpetrators than there appears to be for the equivalent action against those currently considered as terrorists.
Witnessing someone attempting to force entry to your home, leave and then return with a weapon to use in the event that you confront them is a very real and terror inducing prospect for many people in this country.
It MUST be accorded the appropriate seriousness.

attributes.action: Allow 14-15 year olds to consent to sex with someone a maximum of 3 years older
attributes.background: The age of consent is currently 16, and therefore those aged below 16 are prohibited from engaging in sexual; whether protected or unprotected. My proposal is that 14 year olds should be allowed to engage in sexual activity; but only protected, and with partners who are no more than 3 years older.
attributes.additional_details: The age of consent in the UK has been 16 since 1885. Sex education has improved since 1885, and so 14 year-olds nowadays are capable of consenting to safe sex and understand the implications. Most countries in Europe have a lower age of consent than we do, which has led to calls to reduce ours. However, I believe that this is a dangerous move with paedophilia being so common today, and so I believe that my proposal is the best option. Various US states follow legislation similar to my proposal.

attributes.action: "Remain" should not be an option if a second referendum is agreed.
attributes.background:
Including "remain" in any second referendum on the deal achieved by the UK government would only serve to undermine the governments position and be intended to prevent the UK leaving the European Union.

MPs that wish to ignore the vote of the British people should reveal themselves.
attributes.additional_details:
All too often "I respect the outcome of the referendum to leave the European Union...but" is uttered by fervent supporters of the EU.  

It is all too often accompanied by proposals of a second referendum "on the terms" of our exit from the EU; this is designed to undermine UK government negotiations and ultimately thwart the outcome of the referendum of the 23rd June 2016.

A second referendum should only be on the terms agreed to EXIT the EU.

attributes.action: All PMs must state that their duty is to enact the will of the people, not God.
attributes.background: All incoming PMs should be required to publicly confirm that their primary duty is to the electorate and to reaffirm their commitment to their election manifesto.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is not an attack on the right of acting MPs to hold personal religious beliefs. Rather, it is intended to remind our leaders that, in their public capacity, they are ultimately answerable to the electorate and that the manifesto commitments they've made to voters supersede the demands of their personal faith.

attributes.action: Over 55's to take JSA rate if they have paid full contributions for 30 yrs plus.
attributes.background: Give people the option to take early retirement on JSA rate of they have paid full contributions for 30+years. It would enable people to take early pension they have saved and get younger people in work. It could be ERP early retirement pay so they didn't need to sign on.
attributes.additional_details: I work for the local council now aged 57. I have worked all my life and saved for my pension that was suddenly moved from 60 to 66. If I and other people like me could take optional retirement at the rate that is being paid to a adult for on JSA rate, it would help the younger people get work.

attributes.action: Increase National Minimum Wage to a minimum of £20/£25 per hour.
attributes.background: Increase the National Minimum Wage to a fair and decent level so those at the lower end of the employment ladder don't just have to survive or fight tooth and nail to get by. Instead of giving people 'benefits' like Tax Credits use that money to reduce Business Taxes so employers can cover the cost.
attributes.additional_details:
People would rather earn a decent wage than feel like they have to be supported on benefits by the government.

Reducing business taxes in this way would encourage more business to set up and invest in their companies. Also would encourage more businesses to set up in the UK.

The government spends an estimated £30 billion a year on Tax Credit. Don't give handouts to people give them a decent wage and some pride in themselves.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all new parents to learn CPR before leaving maternity unit
attributes.background: Any new parent should be taught CPR and basic life support skills before leaving the maternity into with their newborn child. This should include choking, unconsciousness, CPR to help increase chance of survival if the unimaginable happens.

attributes.action: Ban vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes from UK roads except between 8pm & 8am
attributes.background: The UK has a problem with its ageing road infrastructure that simply cannot cope with the volume of traffic that uses it on a daily basis. The volume of road traffic needs to be spread out across a 24 hour period, lorries greater than 7.5 tonnes should only be permitted to travel between 8pm and 8am
attributes.additional_details: The average daily commute has just increased to 2 hours and the general public is being forced to spend wholly unacceptable amounts of time in cars for what are often small journeys. Forcing drivers off the road through increased taxes or toll roads is not the answer. The answer is obvious but the government won't take the action required to tackle the problem. Road traffic needs to be spread out over the 24 hour period and allow vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes to only travel between 8pm - 8am

attributes.action: Enact a British Bill of Rights before BrExit
attributes.background: Leaving the EU must not leave a vacuum in safeguarding human rights, employment rights and other concerns for British citizens, facing fresh challenges to freedom, rights and duties in the 21st century. No major world power functions without a clear constitution. British citizens deserve clarity,
attributes.additional_details:
Britain's unwritten Constitution: https://www.bl.uk/magna-carta/articles/britains-unwritten-constitution
The UK Constitution; A summary with options for reform: https://www.parliament.uk/documents/commons-committees/political-and-constitutional-reform/The-UK-Constitution.pdf
Crowdsourcing A UK Constitution; costs and benefits: http://blogs.lse.ac.uk/constitutionuk/2014/03/10/crowdsourcing-a-uk-constitution-costs-and-benefits/

attributes.action: Petition to make Dementia Awareness a mandatory subject in citizenship
attributes.background: I currently work in a dementia and complex needs hospital for the mental health service in the east of England. As we are aware, mental health has a stigma; and many don't realise dementia does too! Basic dementia awareness is not known to the general public. This needs to change and quickly.
attributes.additional_details:
Dementia is an umbrella term for a range of cognitive impairments, that progressively get worse over time.
According to Alzheimer's Society - "There are 850,000 people with dementia in the UK, with numbers set to rise to over 1 million by 2025. 225,000 will develop dementia this yea; that’s one every three minutes!" And most shockingly "There are over 40,000 people under 65 with dementia in the UK".

Yet, many people do not have basic understanding of the signs and symptoms for Dementia.

attributes.action: Ensure that fireworks remain unrestricted to the general public.
attributes.background: A petition to ensure that the general public can (and in future will be able to) purchase fireworks for home displays without undue restrictions.

attributes.action: Make the laws protecting chickens apply to all birds including game birds
attributes.background: The suffering of game birds being bred in tiny wire cages for shooting estates on the One Show BBC1 31 October 2016 is sickening. Birds were breaking their necks bashing their heads against the wire roofs of their tiny cages whilst trying to escape. They are then wrongly sold as free range.

attributes.action: Stop the UK selling arms to any side of the Syrian conflict
attributes.background: The only way of ending the conflict in Syria is to stop supplying sides with arms. The UK government has a responsibility to ensure that any involvement in conflicts do not harm the citizens of that country or make the situation worse. Arming any side in Syria is prolonging the conflict.
attributes.additional_details: It is time to do what we can to help Syrian citizens and stop our involvement.

attributes.action: Full pension rights for people thrown out  of the navy for living with ts person
attributes.background: Living with ts person was illegal back in 82, I was kicked out for this crime but I was 21 at the time and doing nothing wrong under cival law, now a days you get to stay in if you fall in love with a ts.I find it repugnent not to eben have had a simple sorry from the powers that be.

attributes.action: To change the laws on criminals being prosecuted on the account of rape.
attributes.background: This petition is to change the minimum jail sentence length and to rule out community service as a legitimate charge. Victims dealing with cases such as this deserve to be able to go about their lives as they wish, without having the fear of running into their offenders.
attributes.additional_details: Personally, I don't think that community service is an appropriate sentence for someone being convicted of rape. The victims and their families would have been put through hell and the perpetrator receiving community service for however long is basically letting them get away with it, when the victims deserve a lot more justice for the crime that was committed.

attributes.action: To reduce fraud, Banks must match Name to the A/C No. before Auth. transactions!
attributes.background: Currently UK banks only check if the sort code and account number is correct before a transaction is authorised. This opens vulnerabilities for fraudsters to exploit the system. In some other countries, if the name does not match the account then the transaction is rejected.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government must make this a statutory requirement.

Example case: 
MARY has building work done by JOHN. JOHN's email is compromised by fraudsters who send MARY payment request to be paid into an account who they say is under JOHNS name. MARY makes a bank transfer to the account and puts JOHN SMITH as Payee. Because the account number is correct the payment is accepted by the receiving bank. The actual account holder is JOE BLOG. Money is immediately withdrawn. The banks do not reimburse Mary.

attributes.action: To increase the age of a child's ticket, from 15 to 17, when traveling on trains
attributes.background: I am a 17 year old, and go to school in the city but live in the suburbs. Therefore I have to travel to school by train. The cost of an adult train fare is significantly more than a child's, considering I am just a child with no source of income, I think I have a right to pay child prices.

attributes.action: Clarify if deal on EU/UK nationals is subject to final Brexit deal vote
attributes.background: While UK gov has stated an early deal is desired about EU nationals in the UK and UK nationals abroad with the EU, UK parliament failed to specify if an early deal is subject to a final vote on the Brexit deal in 2 years time, meaning an early deal can be overturned by UK during the final vote.
attributes.additional_details:
By not clarifying this, there is no guaranteed certainty for EU nationals in the UK and UK nationals abroad until the final vote, which means ongoing insecurity or a false sense of security for the next 2 years.

Clarification would help individuals and businesses plan next steps if this impacts them (relocation, resourcing, housing, etc).

attributes.action: Destroy vehicles & mobiles of drivers caught holding device whilst driving.
attributes.background: On average reaction times for drink drivers are actually less than those using a mobile device behind the wheel, yet drink drive penalties are tougher. The only way to really stop people using a device whilst driving is to destroy the vehicle/device and inforce an immediate 2 year driving ban.
attributes.additional_details:
So, a new law has come into force for drivers using/holding mobile devices whilst operating a motor vehicle on a public highway.
A £200 fine and six points is not enough. Even though the new law has been well publicised people still carry on doing it. Also impose an immediate 2 year driving ban for all not just new drivers. Drivers using mobile phones whilst driving are more dangerous than uninsured drivers. Vehicles and mobile devices should be destroyed just like an uninsured vehicle.

attributes.action: Prohibit schools from confiscating student property for more than one day
attributes.background: It is not clear on how long schools or academies can confisgate the property of students. Therefore schools can keep property for how long they want. I propose that schools should not be able to confisgate property that is not clased by the government as a prohibited item for more than one day.

attributes.action: Make March 29th a public holiday to celebrate article 50 and Brexit.
attributes.background: Britain's exit from the European Union is a hugely significant political, social and economic event. It marks the start of a great new chapter in British history. As such, we should celebrate the triggering of article 50 to mark the start of this process.

attributes.action: Speed up getting Child Benefit and Tax Credits, after residence change by Court.
attributes.background:
I want the law  to be changed, to require the parent losing Residence after a Court Hearing, to inform Child Benefit and Tax Credits in under 7 days, unless a return to Court is Ordered for in under that time 
The current system can take up to 3 months to be awarded, without cooperation from the ex
attributes.additional_details:
In my situation, Residence was changed in my favour unexpectedly due to the actions of Children's Services 1 hour before the Court Hearing. I am now overcrowded by 2 bedrooms and the Housing Department can not help, as the children can only be considered once either is in payment. Child Benefit will post a dispute form out, after 30 days, with 30 days to send it back, and their post turn round is 3 weeks.
Tax Credits will send the form out sooner, but still has 30 days and post turn round time.

attributes.action: Create an "ice cream van exclusion zone" around UK primary schools
attributes.background: Create an ' ice cream van' exclusion zone around primary schools, unless specifically invited onto school grounds for special occasions or an agreed day of the week. The suggested exclusion distance is quarter of a mile.
attributes.additional_details:
Childhood obesity is a growing problem and healthy eating habits are created at a young age. 

Parents want the opportunity for a positive engagement with their child, and not to be immediately catapulted into an argument.

By inviting the vendor onto schools premises on a specific day, parents can plan to treat their children and use it as a motivational tool for good behaviour.

These vans leave their diesel engines idling and often have to park 'inconsideratly' or illegally.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement that all mobility scooter owners have insurance
attributes.background: Scooters are a cheap & affordable means of transport for the elderly & infirm to get about.  With accidents on the rise & with no compulsory insurance required by owners there is very little a member of the public can do to recover compensation when involved in an accident caused by the driver

attributes.action: When selling 2nd hand power tools you must advertise the full serial number.
attributes.background: As a member of the Van and Tool awareness group on Facebook I'm shocked by the blatant resale of stolen tools on popular auction sites. Selling tools with a compulsory Serial number would make tracing stolen tools easier and make steeling them less attractive
attributes.additional_details: Every day I see people posting how their van was broken into and their tools stolen. These are then sold on the popular auction websites. Most  tools for sale could be legitimate and the vendor would  have no problem advertising the serial number. The harder stolen tools are to sale and more traceable they become the less attractive they become to thieves. Ave cost of basic kit is circa £2000 and insurance to cover is prohibitively expensive. Also damage to vehicular to gain entry costs £1000's

attributes.action: Abolish zero hour contracts. Minimum 30 hours a week to be offered to employees.
attributes.background: If the government want to show the people of UK that they are working for and representing them then this should be an absolute priority. People can't live this way any longer, not knowing the amount of money they will receive at the end of the week/month. This includes private and public sectors.

attributes.action: Better Pay for nurses just like paramedics
attributes.background: It was debated in parliament in 2016 fairer pay for paramedics because of the work they do. Their pay has been risen to band 6. So why can't parliament increase pay the same for nurses.

attributes.action: Commemorate Women in the Palace of Westminster
attributes.background: On a visit to the Palace of Westminster yesterday, a woman commented online that "I walked passed at least 200 pictures & statues on my way to the committee room. Other than a pic of Elizabeth 1 & another including 6 Henry-wives, there were no women. Not good enough."
attributes.additional_details:
On International Women's Day, it is time for parliament to recognise the impact and positive influence that women have made throughout history and continue to make in modern society.

Many of these women's incredible achievements have been despite the lack of support & recognition from society.  Let's stop that now.

Time to include women.

We call upon parliament to include women through it's hall and walls.

What do we want our young boys & girls to see when they visit? Their future. Together.

attributes.action: Release the 1921 Census records to the public now.
attributes.background: The latest Census records available to the public are way back in 1911. That's before the First World War. There are a lot of people trying to research their Family History but find it difficult with over 100 years gap on the National Census.
attributes.additional_details:
Signing this partition will help so many families to trace their roots  quicker and if we are successful the rule governing the release of Census records can be reduced from 100 years to 30.
Please check out this link and make up your mind 
http://www.abroadintheyard.com/access-1921-uk-census-now-30-arguments-for-against-early-release/

attributes.action: Make it illegal to pay for parking where you work.
attributes.background: Companies should not make their employees pay for parking where they work, it is unfair and you are basically paying to be at work. Car parks are charging ridiculous amounts which takes a lot of money from your wage at the end of the month.

attributes.action: Reconsider A27 improvement options including a northern route
attributes.background: The A27 around Chichester is a nightmare and finally we had some options but not a Northern Route which the majority wanted. The Transport Department should give us new options but the Minister has blocked it.

attributes.action: Lift the ban of Pit bulls and other dogs affected by BSL in the UK
attributes.background: Many innocent breeds of dogs have been banned from the UK on grounds of them being dangerous - but the animals aren't dangerous and I refuse to allow the government to ban an innocent animal purely because of previous criminal owners forcing them into violence
attributes.additional_details: I know many people are aware of BSL (Breed Specific Legislation) making specifics breeds of dogs banned purely because they could be deemed as dangerous, but I bet you didn't know that in 2015, Jack Russels were the breed most likely to bite in the city of Liverpool (according to police in Liverpool). Furthermore, your household best friend - the Labrador - is also responsible for the highest number of canine attacks according to the pet insurers Animal Friends.

attributes.action: Provide option to transfer from current student loans to future alternative loan
attributes.background: The government indicated in 2014 that an alternative loan would be available this year but it's still in development. Students who cant take interest based loans should not be discouraged from going to university and have the option to take current loan but be able transfer into the alternative loan
